title: Bookkeeper (Remote, Full-Time)
job_overview:
About the Role

We are seeking a detail-oriented and experienced Bookkeeper to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for managing the day-to-day bookkeeping needs of a portfolio of clients, with a focus on accuracy, timeliness, and client service. You'll be working within a supportive team that values collaboration and continuous improvement.

Key Responsibilities

• Manage end-to-end bookkeeping for a portfolio of clients using Xero and other software.
• Prepare and lodge Business Activity Statements (BAS).
• Handle payroll processing and superannuation obligations as required.
• Maintain detailed and organized work papers and client records.
• Liaise with clients to clarify financial data and improve record-keeping practices.
• Collaborate with accountants to ensure seamless client support and compliance.
• Support general administrative and accounting tasks as needed.

Qualifications & Experience

• Minimum 2-3 years of bookkeeping experience (public practice or similar environment preferred).
• Proficiency in Xero and its ecosystem.
• Bookkeeping or Accounting qualifications highly regarded.
• Experience with Microsoft Office 365, particularly Outlook, Excel, Word, and Teams.
• Familiarity with Australian Taxation and compliance requirements is highly desirable.

 Why Join Us?

• A collaborative and professional work culture.
• Exposure to a diverse range of clients and industries.
• Growth opportunities in a supportive environment.
• Flexible working arrangements available.

How to Apply

Please send your resume and a brief cover letter outlining your suitability for the role.
